title: In desperate need of this condensed grotesque...
content:
I have been looking for this font for the past few years. The most distinguishable characthers are the "S" and "R" which make them look different from the many look-a-likes.   
   
The font is NOT:   
Compacta   
Haettenschwiller   
Impact   
Soft Hits   
Gogo Big   
Gogo Squat   
California Grotesk   
   
   
   
Here are the links: They are a bit embarassing, but, oh well   
   
 [http://www.lonestarspice.com/albums/swjapback.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052125/http:/www.lonestarspice.com/albums/swjapback.jpg)   
   
 [http://www.lonestarspice.com/videos/istanbulvcd.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052125/http:/www.lonestarspice.com/videos/istanbulvcd.jpg)   
   
 [http://www.lonestarspice.com/videos/istanbulcd1.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052125/http:/www.lonestarspice.com/videos/istanbulcd1.JPG)   
   
 [http://www.lonestarspice.com/videos/wembley1cd.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052125/http:/www.lonestarspice.com/videos/wembley1cd.JPG)   
   
The font was also used on the Johnny English movie poster. Like the previous pictures, it's the text in the grey and red on this link:   
   
 [http://images.art.com/images/products/regular/10104000/10104782.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052125/http:/images.art.com/images/products/regular/10104000/10104782.jpg)
author: cwang011

comments.content: Looks to me like they took something similar to the weight and proportions of Helvetica Ultra Compressed and stretched it horizontally. (It's not Helvetica Ultra Compressed--I tried it. Some of the characters are close matches, but others are quite different.)

Hmmm...I have seen this font used in the 'Virgin Megastore' logo, but I think they have changed it since then, but the font might be very condensed in its regular form. I will try to find a picture of it.
I think the one in the "Johnny English" poster is FB Agency, but the one in the lone star spice site is similar, but a different one; the "S" looks different.
OOPS! my bad, not FB Agency either, i just checked on Font Bureau's site.
